intro: Kleinia cliffordiana, commonly known as the clifford's kleiniopsis, is a succulent shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in summer. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in poor, well-drained soils make it well adapted to rocky and coastal environments. Kleinia cliffordiana is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and drought tolerance.
